meanings.sent1: She fell down and landed right on her patooty.
meanings.sent2: The baby's diaper was full, so she patted his patooty gently.
meanings.sent3: During the dance, he accidentally bumped into her patooty and apologized.
meanings.sent4: The cat's tail looked like a fluffy patooty swishing around.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's chubby patooty wiggled as he tried to stand up.

meanings.definition: A term of endearment or affectionate nickname.
meanings.sent1: Grandma always calls me her little patooty when I visit.
meanings.sent2: The couple exchanged sweet words, like 'honey' and 'patooty'.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said, 'Come here, you little patooty!' to his dog.
meanings.sent4: The old teddy bear was named 'Patooty' by its owner.
meanings.sent5: She smiled and said, 'You're my favorite patooty in the whole world!'
